paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the -26 G>A polymorphism in the BRCA2 gene and its association with breast cancer susceptibility, including penetrance data.

functional_data.summary: The A allele increased reporter gene expression by twice that of the G allele in MCF-7 and HeLa cells.

variants.segregation_data: The heterozygous genotype was found to be protective in nature.
variants.additional_notes: The study indicates that the heterozygous genotype provides protection against breast cancer.
key_quotes: The heterozygous genotype provided approximately twice the protection than the common G/G homozygous state (Pheterozygote advantage model = 0.0005, odds ratio [OR] = 0.5, 95% confidence interval [CI] = 0.4 to 0.8).

tables_processed.table_caption: Genotype and allele frequencies of BRCA2 -26 and p53 codon 72 polymorphisms in sporadic breast cancer patients and normal controls

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant data was clearly presented in the text and tables.
